channel.title: Good Gaming Mouse for 50-
channel.description:
I am looking for a decent gaming mouse under 50 dollars. It needs to have at least two side buttons, other than that, I don't care. What do you guys think I should get?
Whoever finds me the cheapest mouse with side buttons gets an e-cookie. Oh, and it has to be black to match my computer.

item.title: Good Gaming Mouse for 50-
item.dc:creator: Jeannotvb
item.description:
I’ve had three gaming computers in the past, with the first I bought the MX518 mouse which I’m still using. It looks old and worn down but it still works fantastic, it’s the only part I still have from my first PC.

In other words; it’s fucking amazing.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: Phat
item.description:
It’s a waste of money -that extra precision you buy imo
I have logitech wave keyboard and mouse combo (it’s extra ergonomic)

Read full topic

item.title: Good Gaming Mouse for 50-
item.dc:creator: Zageron
item.description:
Also the main difference between a gaming mouse and a regular mouse is that a regular mouse has a polling rate of 125Hz and around 400dpi, where a gaming mouse can have a polling rate of 1000Hz and anything from 900 to 10000dpi+ (I think 5600 is the highest I’ve seen)

Read full topic

item.title: Good Gaming Mouse for 50-
item.dc:creator: faelnor
item.description:
I got a laser Logitech G5 a while back, fantastic gaming mouse. Love the form and feel.

Read full topic

item.title: Good Gaming Mouse for 50-
item.dc:creator: jonegomes
item.description:
I’ve never bought a gaming mouse before in my life. I’m a wireless guy, but for a good mouse I’m tempted to go back to wired, the only decent wireless mouse I’ve found is something from Microsoft but its like £50. So, What gaming mouse is recommended? And what advantages will one give me over my Standard Logitech Optical mouse. It came with my MX3200, so should be too much of a BAD mouse.
Anyway, good advantages?

Read full topic

item.description:
That’s because you don’t need to write “computer mouse” just write “razer mouse” or “logitech mouse” etc.

item.title: Good Gaming Mouse for 50-
item.dc:creator: Sampdel
item.description:
Lord Grievous:

I tried looking for computer mice on ebay because I want a better one too then I tried computer mouse then even computer mouses and all I could find was stuff like that.

item.title: Good Gaming Mouse for 50-
item.dc:creator: Osterman
item.description:
I had the MX518 and I really liked it but unfortunately the cord broke and it started skipping. Now I have MX1100 which is okay, but the dpi settings aren’t as good and it does sometimes freeze, it’s rare but it does happen which feels like having a broken cord all over again so the wireless feature feels completely useless. Both have a really good design, MX1100 in particular so they are comfortable to use. I’ll most likely get something with a wire the next time if I can find a mouse with the features I like.

Read full topic

item.title: Good Gaming Mouse for 50-
item.dc:creator: Siggs
item.description:
Grey Acumen:

https://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16826105183

USB
Wired
2 extra buttons
scroll wheel is notched
laser
ambidextrous

It’s worked beautifully for me.

I used to have a microsoft mouse on my desktop, it’s REALLY heavy, and has kind of sluggish response to me, although it is quite an old one. Also, the older ones have incredibly bad, strong notches on the wheel, but I know that was fixed The ultimate mouse is a Logitech MX Revolution, but I think that might be outside your price rage. And it isn’t specifically a gaming mouse.

I’d still say go Logitech;

Click for the newegg page
.

Read full topic

item.title: Good Gaming Mouse for 50-
item.dc:creator: MaxTheLimit
item.description:
Zageron:

If you’re looking for a mouse, the Razer Lycosa is really good. Just don’t buy keyboards from them.

The lycosa IS a keyboard. From Razer you might be able to get the Death Adder, or the abyssus.

But for 50 bucks you gotta get the MX518. End of thread.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Good Gaming Mouse for 50-
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
Hubbe:

If you don’t mind batteries… The Logitech MX1100 is a good mouse.
And it is black. It is wireless, but there is hardly any interferance on the 2.4 gHz band anyway.

If you think that’s too much of a hassle, the Logitech MX518 Gaming Mouse is a really good corded mouse.
It’s also a bit cheaper than the MX1100.

Meh, for 10 bucks more than the corded one I could get a pretty good razer.

Read full topic
